docs.title: 👁️ Project Ojo
docs.text: An open-source, crowd-driven intelligence platform for recognizing and disrupting human trafficking.

docs.title: Why We Exist
docs.text:
Millions of victims go unidentified. The systems built to find them weren’t made for them.

Project Ojo exists to map patterns, expose trafficking routes, and empower those on the front lines with actionable intelligence.

docs.title: What You'll Find Here
docs.text:
🧠 Patterns Tactics traffickers use—from bar recruitment to fake jobs and public scouting.

🌐 Locations Hot zones and blind spots: transit hubs, ports, streets, markets, and more.

🌎 Country Breakdowns What to know, where to avoid, and how scouts operate—per country.

🛡️ Victim Recognition How to identify victims by behavior, situation, or psychological signs.

🤝 How to Contribute Submit intel, help map new regions, or join the mission.

docs.title: Who It's For
docs.text:
• Investigators
  • NGOs
  • Journalists
  • Travelers
  • Locals
  • Survivors
  • You

“Just because they’re hidden, doesn’t mean we can’t find them.”

Want to submit data? See how to contribute →

docs.title: Future Country Coverage
docs.text: We're actively building out Project Ojo’s global field guide. These countries are on our roadmap for coverage and contribution:

docs.title: 🌍 Europe
docs.text:
• Romania
  • Bulgaria
  • Moldova
  • Ukraine
  • Albania

Want to help us build the field report for any of these regions? Submit here or reach out via GitHub Issues.
